Window Managers
Window Mangers et Desktop Environments are the primary user interfaces into the X Windows System. A window manager is a program that controls the appearance of windows et provides the means by which the user can interact with them. A Desktop Environment provides a more complete interface to the operating system, et provides a range of integrated utilities et applications.
There are many Window Mangers available. Some of the more well known ones include fvwm2, Window Maker, AfterStep, Enlightenment, Sawfish, and Blackbox.
The Desktop Environments available for Linux are GNOME, KDE, et XFce.
Choosing a Window Manager or Desktop Environment is highly subjective. The choice depends on the look et feel of the packages, the resources (RAM, disk space) required, et the utilities included. One web site that provides a very good summary of what is available, screenshots, and their respective features is Window Managers for X.
In this chapter, the installation instructions of several Window Managers are presented. Later in the book, both KDE et Gnome have their own Parts.
